column5: Well What a difference a Day makes. Yesterday -27 This AM -12  Where we got Whities yesterday only could entice 1 today,  So we were on the move and Budda Boom Budda Bing  Fish On. Ok we have our Whities. and it is FAR TOO nice a Day to go Home yet!! Lets go 'Looking for Lakers!!!  Meegs was again the lure that put the most fish on the Ice But the Williams did produce also.   We go Wandering Aimlessly, Drilling and Jigging and We Do find one Laker and 3 more Whities.  TRavelling was good, and for the most part the Sleds are still staying on top, did get into one small slush bed, The slush has been tightening up over the last Cold Nights However with the Warm temps and winds comming they will likely not freeze overnight and will get bigger,  So play Safe and Have Fun  One of Each From To-Day     Rick
Sweet, I'm hoping to get out there on Monday. Likely be a swimming pool by then.  Oh and nice hat, looks a lot like the one I have.
Looks like you had a great day. That's one deep whitey.  Rick
Beautiful whitie and laker Rick       Congratulations Thanks for sharing Leechman

Thanx Guys  It was a VERY F U N Day  Spiel  You likely got your Hat about the same time as I got Mine!!! Don is A Good Guy  I miss his board. Travel with care on Monday!!  I am back to Work tomorrow So you guys "Get 'Er Done'"  Rick
Yes Don is certainly top shelf. I hope to be able to share another day on the ice with him, sooooon.

Way to go Rick. What ever it takes to find them ;-) Love your fish photos, like they just came out of the water few seconds ago, so clean and good looking ha ha ha. You did manage to find a laker as well!  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
Hey Ice  Yes We did get one Laker !! and found another 'SPOT' for Whities!!  Rick
Great looking fish Rick.  Sounds like another awesome day on Simcoe.  You ever hear from Don?

Hi Ben  He was out at Gilford for some early Ice Perching in December. However we did not get together.  From what I hear or have been told, since His trailor and ALL the gear was stolen, he has not done a lot of Ice stuff!!  He is mainly into the Bass touneys,  Rick
